content:
That sounds like an awesome fishing trip! Lake Michigan can be a fantastic spot for walleye fishing, and silver spinnerbaits are a great choice for targeting them. It's always exciting to catch a bunch of fish, especially when you're sharing the experience with friends.

I'm curious, what was the most memorable part of your trip? Was there a particular fish that stood out, or a funny moment that you'll always remember?

Also, did you find that the walleye were holding to any specific structure or areas on Lake Michigan? Were you fishing in a particular depth range or targeting specific types of habitat?

Sharing your experiences and insights can help other anglers, and I'm always eager to learn more about fishing techniques and strategies!
